react.label: React
react.description: A JavaScript library for building fast, interactive user interfaces.

java.label: Java
java.description: A high-level, class-based programming language used for building cross-platform applications.

javafx.label: JavaFX
javafx.description: A Java library for building rich client desktop applications with modern UIs.

typescript.label: TypeScript
typescript.description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language.

javascript.label: Javascript
javascript.description: The programming language of the Web, used for building dynamic websites and applications.

nodejs.label: Node.js
nodejs.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for building fast, scalable server applications.

express.label: Express.js
express.description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework for building APIs and web apps.

mongodb.label: MongoDB
mongodb.description: A NoSQL document database designed for high scalability and flexibility.

postgresql.label: PostgreSQL
postgresql.description: An open-source relational database system known for its reliability and advanced features.

sqlserver.label: SQL Server
sqlserver.description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft, used in enterprise environments.

powerapps.label: Microsoft Power Apps
powerapps.description: A Microsoft service for building low-code custom applications quickly and easily.

electron.label: Electron.js
electron.description: A framework for building cross-platform desktop apps using web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

mui.label: Material UI
mui.description: A popular React UI framework offering prebuilt, customizable components based on Material Design.

python.label: Python
python.description: A high-level programming language known for its readability and vast ecosystem for web, data, and automation.

vscode.label: Visual Studio Code
vscode.description: Visual Studio Code (VS Code) is a free, open-source code editor developed by Microsoft.

poweron.label: PowerOn
poweron.description: Proprietary programming language by JHA, primarily used with the Symitar core for credit unions

php.label: PHP
php.description: PHP, standing for Hypertext Preprocessor, is a widely used, open-source, server-side scripting language primarily used for web development.

alteryx.label: Alteryx
alteryx.description: Alteryx is a low-code/no-code platform for data analytics and workflow automation.

jira.label: Atlassian Jira
jira.description: Atlassian's project management and issue tracking tool.

gitlab.label: GitLab
gitlab.description: GitLab is a web-based Git repository manager and DevOps platform that enables software development teams to collaborate, manage their code, and automate their CI/CD pipelines.

github.label: GitHub
github.description: GitHub is a cloud-based platform for version control and collaboration, primarily used by software developers.

aix.label: IBM AIX
aix.description: IBM AIX is a proprietary Unix operating system developed and sold by IBM since 1986.

sqlite.label: SQLite
sqlite.description: SQLite is a lightweight, self-contained, serverless, zero-configuration SQL database engine.

rally.label: Rally
rally.description: Broadcomâ€™s Rally is an enterprise agile management solution and comprehensive agile project management tool.

chatgpt.label: ChatGPT
chatgpt.description: ChatGPT is an advanced AI chatbot developed by OpenAI that utilizes natural language processing to generate humanlike conversational responses and perform various writing tasks.

react-native.label: React Native
react-native.description: React Native is a framework developed by Meta for building cross-platform mobile apps using JavaScript and React. It allows developers to write code once and deploy to both iOS and Android with near-native performance.

expo.label: Expo
expo.description: Expo is an open-source platform for developing, building, and deploying React Native apps faster. It includes tools, libraries, and services that simplify development, especially for teams and solo developers without native code experience.

react-paper.label: React Native Paper
react-paper.description: React Native Paper is a high-quality, themable component library for React Native, based on Material Design guidelines. It provides ready-to-use UI elements with built-in support for dark/light themes and accessibility.
